name: places/ChIJxTKL58NYwokRLgVdssoa4RU
formattedAddress: 1305 York Ave 11th Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1305 York Ave 11th Floor, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: Dr. Levey is a great Doctor- he was very clear and direct in explaining what my daughter needed. I also appreciate his honesty and setting expectations. We also appreciated him using surgery as a last resort.

text.text: Dr. Levey is a great Doctor- he was very clear and direct in explaining what my daughter needed. I also appreciate his honesty and setting expectations. We also appreciated him using surgery as a last resort.

originalText.text: This rating is for the staff at 212 E 69th St on November 17th 2021 visit. This review was put up a year ago and was on a review on the wrong doctor. My review concerns the 2 ladies at the reception and another for the nurse for Dr. Levy. I set an appointment with Dr. Levy months in advance to check for my daughters eye sight. She had the common cold a week before that and was recovering from that. We got the “ok” from our pediatrician and other doctors from the Weill Cornell group that she was ok to go to daycare and interact with other people. When we reached the hospital, I was asked for the physical insurance card, which I didn’t have with me since I’ve uploaded a copy through the portal and I never had to use the physical copy for any of the clinics or hospitals within the Weill Cornell group so I didn’t carry it with me. The receptionist lady asked me to bring it next time around when I visit and it was ok for me this time not to carry it with me. The nurse came through later and started whispering that my daughter had the common cold a few days ago and started making snide comments that we shouldn’t be at the clinic to the receptionist. I was shocked that she didn’t speak to me directly about it. I was happy to leave and reschedule but she said the doctor will see me. The nurse continued making snide comments throughout the session and started scaring my daughter who was crying uncontrollably. She was scaring my daughter away because she had a common cold. This team at this location is highly unprofessional, made me and my daughter feel extremely uncomfortable. I would have rather have had them reschedule us than make snide comments and make us feel uncomfortable. I understand due the COVID situation, they are being extra careful but they should be professional about it than do something you don’t want to do like look at my daughter and make snide comments to my 14 month old. Never again to this location due to the unprofessional staff. After the horrendous visit, over the last 1.5 years, I’ve been getting automatic updates to visit Dr levy’s office for a follow up eye visit from Weill Cornell. I cannot imagine putting my daughter through that again so no thank you.

originalText.text:
I am a patient under Dr Levy although I am posting on my daughters account. I am set for Surgery on Oct 6 of this year. However all my visits and experiences with Dr Levy have been phenomenal, I never had to wait long in the waiting room and I found Dr Levys staff to be very helpful and thorough. Dr Levy has given me great confidence that he can correct my eye problem. He patiently listened to all my questions and concerns and answered each one in great detail. I never felt rushed. I look forward to following up with another wonderful review after the Surgery goes well. I highly recommend Dr Richard Levy :)

Follow up post
I had my surgery date moved up to Sept 28 and I am writing this on Sept 29. I am happy to report that the Surgery with Dr Levy went very well. Although I am only a day out. I feel extremely confident that my eyesight is on the way to tremendous recovery thanks in part to Dr Levy.  I am also obligated to say that Dr Levy is punctual and was exactly on time for my post op video teleconference. All in all I could not be happier with Dr Levy and his team :))

-Shabsai Uvsitzky

originalText.text: I would not recommend waiting for an appointment for the doc specifically, as when you arrive they just have junior associates conducting the examinations anyway. I guess this is what happens when you grow to big and have multiple offices.

text.text: I would not recommend waiting for an appointment for the doc specifically, as when you arrive they just have junior associates conducting the examinations anyway. I guess this is what happens when you grow to big and have multiple offices.

originalText.text:
A fantastic doctor, extremely talented and able to answer all of our questions and work with us to feel comfortable about the decisions. My son has been seeing him for 10 years now for checks post childhood cataracts surgery at 6 months.
Mentioned by another reviewer, many times we are seen by a resident, a lot of times very qualified, but yes you may occasionally get someone that's a bit fresh.  Dr Levy does check their work and it's great to know that they are growing talent in this field.
